intro: Mycaranthes monostachya, commonly known as the single-stemmed mycaranthes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stem and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that are often followed by red, berry-like fruits. Mycaranthes monostachya is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
